Quality Assurance, Beaufort, SC — RADAR Collateral Duty Inspector

July 2017 - PRESENT

  • Inspect processes, our work requires us to have certain work stoppages to complete important safety measures that will ensure the life of the pilot and the succession of the mission.
  • Supervise, to ensure quality work I taught and assisted workers on the correct processes and relaying the experience I have gained throughout my years.
  • Be the subject matter expert RADAR Technician, whether you are new or have been around a while, everyone has questions and are encouraged to ask, it's my job to answer those in full and if I don’t know the answer to find it and get back with them.

Electronics Technician, Beaufort, SC — RADAR Technician

JAN 2014 - PRESENT

  • Test, troubleshoot, and repair down to component level F/A 18 Hornet RADAR systems and the Test Equipment it runs on.
  • Interpret ATLAS program code to determine the engineers intent on each automated test. The systems in place are from around the 90s, it is my job to take what they put in place then and apply it to the issues that we have now.
